intro: Calceolaria chimboracensis, commonly known as the Chimborazo slipperflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Calceolaria chimboracensis is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to the specific microclimates of its native habitat. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species in botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
